label: craniofacial dysmorphism, skeletal anomalies, and impaired intellectual development syndrome
developmental delay with short stature, dysmorphic facial features, and sparse hair
congenital heart disease, multiple types-GATA4
definition: Any congenital heart disease in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the GATA4 gene.

label: familial sudden death
definition: An instance of sudden cardiac death that is caused by an inherited genomic modification in an individual.

label: CHRNG-associated hypo-akinesia disorder of prenatal onset
definition: A spectrum of presentations resulting from biallelic protein-altering variation in CHRNG. Inactivation of the receptor during early development leads to prenatal hypo-akinesia; subsequent phenotypes are a consequence of this hypo-akinesia and are thought to be dependent upon timing and severity of the anomaly at the neuromuscular junction. A range of phenotypes varying in severity (including both lethal and non-lethal presentations) have been reported, but typically include joint contractures, pterygia, dysmorphic features, vertebral and thoracic anomalies, and additional variable abnormalities. There are no clear genotype-phenotype correlations between the lethal and non-lethal presentations of this spectrum; both inter- and intra-familial variability have been reported, with the same variants being observed in both lethal and non-lethal cases.

label: gastric intestinal metaplasia
definition: Metaplastic changes in the lining of the upper digestive tract.

label: self-limited familial neonatal-infantile epilepsy
definition: An epilepsy syndrome associated with infantile period seizures, complete or nearly-complete seizure remission afterwards, usually good developmental outcome, and dominant transmission with high penetrance in pedigrees. For most affected infants, seizures begin within the first week after term birth. In a minority, however, seizures can begin after the first week but within the first several months of life. At onset, seizures may be highly recurrent, and often feature unilateral tonic limb stiffening that may alternate sides from seizure to seizure, accompanied by cyanosis and autonomic features. Limb shaking movements occur, but not in the evolving rhythmic pattern of tonic-clonic convulsions in older individuals. Neurological examination of the infant is normal between seizures. Although these seizures remit by 4-12 months of age in the majority, 15-30% of those affected have one or more seizure recurrences later, including febrile seizures, focal-onset seizures, and convulsions. Although most affected children show typical development, individuals with mild learning difficulties have been reported in families where the majority develop typically.

label: DICER1-related tumor predisposition
definition: Pathogenic germline variation in DICER1 confers an autosomal dominant predisposition to tumor formation at multiple primary sites, including pleuropulmonary blastoma, pulmonary cysts, thyroid gland neoplasia, ovarian tumors, and cystic nephroma. Other syndromic features such as macrocephaly have been described.

label: ALS2-related motor neuron disease
definition: Any motor neuron disease in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ALS2 gene.

label: FOXC1-related anterior segment dysgenesis
definition: Any anterior segment dysgenesis in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the FOXC1 gene.

label: LTBP2-related ocular dysgenesis
definition: Any ocular dysgenesis disorder in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the LTBP2 gene.

label: CACNA1A-related complex neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: A progressive complex neurodevelopmental condition caused by variants in the CACNA1A gene. Phenotypic onset (usually) occurs around age 1 and most often includes intellectual disability but can also include epileptic encephalopathy, benign paroxysmal torticollis of infancy and paroxysmal tonic upgaze psychomotor delay, learning difficulties, absence epilepsy, episodic ataxia, and hemiplegic migraines.

label: sudden cardiac arrest
definition: The sudden loss of all heart activity due to an irregular heart rhythm.

label: baclofen withdrawal syndrome
definition: Withdrawal syndrome involving the abrupt discontinuation of baclofen therapy (intrathecal or oral). Baclofen withdrawal syndrome can result in high fever, altered mental status (including agitation, insomnia, confusion, delusions, hallucinations, seizures, visual changes, or psychosis), and potentially profound muscular rigidity that sometimes progresses to fatal rhabdomyolysis.

label: premenopausal osteoporosis
definition: Osteoporosis occuring in premenopausal women with existing fragility fractures, diseases or treatments known to cause bone loss or fractures.

label: hand-foot syndrome
definition: A condition characterized by redness, pain, swelling, and tingling in the palms of the hands or the soles of the feet. It may appear as a side effect to chemotherapy agents.

label: infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: bacterial infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Bacterial infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: viral infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Viral infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: fungal infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Fungal infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

definition: Actinobacillus infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

definition: Rhabdoviridae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

definition: Reoviridae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: Anaplasmataceae infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Anaplasmataceae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: vector-borne disease, non-human animal
definition: Vector-borne disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: tick-borne infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Tick-borne infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: Bunyaviridae infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Bunyaviridae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: pestivirus infectious disease, non-human animal

label: trichostrongyloidiasis, non-human animal
definition: Trichostrongyloidiasis that occurs in non-human animals.

label: ehrlichiosis, non-human animal
definition: Ehrlichiosis that occurs in non-human animals.

label: Parvoviridae infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Parvoviridae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: Caliciviridae infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Caliciviridae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: Strongylida infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Strongylida infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: enterovirus infectious disease, non-human animal

label: Erysipelothrix infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Erysipelothrix infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: tuberculosis, non-human animal

label: trypanosomiasis, non-human animal
definition: Trypanosomiasis that occurs in non-human animals.

label: Herpesviridae infectious disease, non-human animal
definition: Herpesviridae infectious disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: craniofacial dysmorphism, skeletal anomalies, and impaired intellectual development 1
definition: Any craniofacial dysmorphism, skeletal anomalies, and impaired intellectual development in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the TMCO1 gene.

label: Carey-Fineman-Ziter syndrome 1
definition: A rare condition characterized by the association of hypotonia, Moebius sequence (bilateral congenital facial palsy with impairment of ocular abduction), Pierre-Robin sequence (micrognathia, glossoptosis, and high-arched or cleft palate), unusual face, and growth delay.

label: developmental delay with short stature, dysmorphic facial features, and sparse hair 1
definition: Any developmental delay with short stature, dysmorphic facial features, and sparse hair in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the DPH1 gene.

label: congenital neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis
definition: Congenital neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis (CNCL) is a severe form of neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis (NCL; see this term) with onset at birth characterized by primary microcephaly, neonatal epilepsy, and death in early infancy.

label: anterior segment developmental abnormality with extraocular manifestations
